image.altText: Jamie Melham kisses the 2025 Melbourne Cup after riding Half Yours to victory.

props.synopsis: Jamie Melham has become the second female jockey to win the Melbourne Cup, riding Half Yours to a famous victory at Flemington.

title.children: Melham makes Cup history, as top jockey suffers nasty fall in later race

image.altText: A woman wearing an outlandish hat

props.synopsis: The 165th running of the Melbourne Cup is set to be a soggy one, as rain drenches the city ahead of the race that stops a nation.

title.children: Fashion lights up Flemington for the Melbourne Cup

image.altText: A centrlink sign through a bush.

props.synopsis: Fugitives on the run and wanted for some of the most serious crimes and sexual offences could soon be stripped of their welfare payments.

title.children: Fears fugitive welfare cut-off will capture innocent people

image.altText: A man in a khaki shirt holds up a mouse.

props.synopsis: The CSIRO is urging farmers to reduce opportunities for mice breeding this harvest season as the threat of a pest population boom looms.

title.children: Worrying signs another mouse plague could be on the way

image.altText: An illustration of an egg being inseminated, viewed under a microscope.

props.synopsis: In an email seen by the ABC, a US-based egg bank told IVF clinics it was introducing its new "Client Success Reward Program in Australia".

title.children: IVF 'reward' scheme proposed by egg and sperm bank sparks concern

image.altText: An artist's impression of a streetscape in a redeveloped Fishermans Bend.

props.synopsis: It has been touted as "Australia's largest urban renewal project" right next to one of the country's biggest CBDs. But critics say the development is being held back.

title.children: Fishermans Bend set to be 'biggest planning failure in Australia's history'

image.altText: Eli Katoa crouches down with a trainer near him

props.synopsis: Former NRL star Shaun Johnson has called for heads to roll after the "scary" incidents that saw Eliesa Katoa requiring oxygen pitchside after suffering three head knocks in Tonga's clash with New Zealand at Eden Park.

title.children: 'I feel a bit angry': Ex-player condemns handling of Katoa concussion

image.altText: Erin Patterson being led into a prison van

props.synopsis: The triple-murderer lodges documents in Victoria's Court of Appeal requesting an appeal against her convictions.

title.children: Erin Patterson lodges mushroom murder appeal documents

image.altText: A dimly lit pokies room with bright colourful lights coming from each of the machines.

props.synopsis: There are calls for football teams to distance themselves from poker machines after data found more than $110 million was lost at venues owned by football clubs and leagues in the last financial year.

title.children: Each day, these football-owned poker machines rake in more than $300k

image.altText: A man in a green vest with a blurred face allegedly being hit in the face

props.synopsis: A teenager involved in the violent attack on a security guard that forced a country Victorian shopping centre into lockdown avoids jail.

title.children: Teenager who king-hit country security guard avoids conviction

image.altText: A jockey sits on his horse and raises his arms in the air, surrounded by a sea of fans at Flemington on Melbourne Cup day.

props.synopsis: From quiet beginnings, an unknown English filly came Down Under and changed Australia's racing history by achieving the impossible. This is how Makybe Diva won a historic third Melbourne Cup 20 years ago.

title.children: 'A champion becomes a legend': Makybe Diva's 'impossible' third Cup win

image.altText: Building exterior with Australian emblem, signage.

props.synopsis: The use of artificial intelligence to prepare court documents raises questions in the legal profession about its use and misuse in the industry.

title.children: Legal errors raise questions over AI use in Victorian courtrooms

image.altText: Saraid Taylor of the Demons looks on during the AFLW round two match

props.synopsis: North Melbourne may be undefeated for the second home and away season in a row, but a star Melbourne player says the short AFLW season means they haven't proven themselves against everyone.

title.children: Dees defender says Roos 'haven't proven themselves' against every team

image.altText: Security camera footage showing a flash of light from a meteor during the day.

props.synopsis: Victorians living in the state's Gippsland region say they saw a streak of light whizzing through the Sunday afternoon sky and heard a sonic boom, with many wondering if they saw space junk or a meteor.

title.children: 'Highly unusual' suspected meteor event seen across Victorian sky

image.altText: GettyImages-2244582910

props.synopsis: The Storm say Eli Katoa had surgery after suffering "seizure activity" following multiple head knocks in the Tonga and New Zealand clash, and the league and players' association are set to investigate.

title.children: NRL to probe handling of Katoa's head knocks after 'seizure activity'

image.altText: Jockey looks to the camera at the winning post, smiling after winning.

props.synopsis: Jockey Jamie Melham says she will be doing a "rain dance" on Monday, ahead of riding Melbourne Cup favourite Half Yours.

title.children: Melham confident Melbourne Cup favourite will handle rain and distance

image.altText: An ambulance drives down a city street at night.

props.synopsis: Victorians are being urged to only call triple-0 for critical cases as demand for an ambulance soars on the quasi-Melbourne Cup long weekend.

title.children: Code Orange called as demand for ambulances soars in Melbourne, Geelong

image.altText: four climbers on belay while two are on the rock face. all wearing colourful helmets.

props.synopsis: Rock climbers are publicly urging others to ignore Parks Victoria's requests to avoid culturally significant routes at Mount Arapiles Dyurrite in western Victoria.

title.children: 'Keep climbing': Defiance grows over Mount Arapiles cultural requests

image.altText: An edited image showing a horse removed from the picture during the Melbourne Cup.

props.synopsis: For years, the racing industry has been quietly removing falls and deaths from its replays. Now, industry insiders are speaking out.

title.children: These are the falls and deaths racing doesn't want you to see

image.altText: Man with glasses and a hat standing in front of a rose bush.

props.synopsis: A veteran in Victoria says he found hope and solace in his local RSL that "had his back" when he felt overwhelmed by his wife's early onset dementia.

title.children: How a regional RSL helped a veteran during a time of darkness

image.altText: man in maroon knit shows printed photos to his smiling elderly mother wearing a red headscarf and blue shirt.

props.synopsis: Discussing aged care in culturally diverse families can be a sensitive subject. Here's how some approached the conversation.

title.children: Diverse families struggle navigating the stigma around aged care

image.altText: An older woman wearing a netball dress smiles and poses next to a teenage girl wearing the same uniform

props.synopsis: A grandmother and granddaughter played for their regional Victorian netball team, turning a secret plan into a moment of country sport history.

title.children: Nan and teen granddaughter line up together in a netball game for the ages

image.altText: A red brick school building with manicured lawns and gardens.

props.synopsis: A prestigious private school in regional Victoria, accused of ignoring a toxic cycle of violence, has been banned from accepting new boarding students until it can prove it complies with safety standards.

title.children: Prestigious Victorian school's boarders ban until proven safe

image.altText: Ben Austin's photo on a screen at a cricket ground

props.synopsis: Cricketers at the highest levels of the sport have paid tribute to 17-year-old Ben Austin who died on Thursday after being struck by a ball at a training session.

title.children: Minute's silence at MCG as cricketing world raises its bat for Ben Austin

image.altText: A jockey on a horse smiling, leaning forward to pat its head, with a crowd in the background.

props.synopsis: Two years after a near-fatal fall, 25-year-old Alice Springs-born jockey has had a bumper season with 32 wins. Now he is riding in the Melbourne Cup.

title.children: Alice Springs jockey to ride in Cup two years after near-fatal fall

image.altText: A slightly run-down wood panel house with a neatly mown lawn.

props.synopsis: The median house price in regional Victoria is $636,500. But what that will get you can look very different from place to place.

title.children: What does the average house price get you in regional Victoria?

image.altText: A man in a dark-blue shirt stands in the middle of a winery with bottles light up on the walls.

props.synopsis: From wine in 187ml bottles to spirits in sleek aluminium cans, producers are downsizing to meet a growing demand for convenience and variety.

title.children: Alcohol industry explores smaller packaging for 'promiscuous' customers

image.altText: An illustration of the silhouette of two people wearing sling and bandage behind a bag of fruits and vegetables.

props.synopsis: Many young people on the Working and Holiday Visa programs come to Australia to fill labour shortages in industries like meat processing and farming, but there are concerns around their health and safety in dangerous workplaces.

title.children: Holiday workers risking injury so Australians can get meat

image.altText: A red flare goes off in the crowd at a Melbourne Oasis concert.

props.synopsis: A flare let off by a crowd member at the first of three Melbourne Oasis concerts has angered the band's co-founder Liam Gallagher, sparking an expletive-laden post.

title.children: 'You will get yours': Liam Gallagher incensed by fan's flare at Melbourne Oasis concert

image.altText: A man in a black suit flanked by security guards exits a prison van and enters the Supreme Court of Victoria.

props.synopsis: Greg Lynn's lawyer says the prosecution "played outside the rules" during the former Jetstar pilot's double-murder trial last year as he appeals his conviction and sentence.

title.children: Greg Lynn faces court in bid to quash High Country murder conviction

image.altText: A Facebook post written by Isla Bell's mother with a photo of Isla smiling underneath

props.synopsis: A judge rules there is enough evidence to send Marat Ganiev and co-accused Eyal Yaffe to trial over the death of the 19-year-old, whose body was found at a tip in Melbourne's south-east last year.

title.children: Melbourne woman Isla Bell's alleged murderer committed to stand trial

image.altText: North Melbourne plays stand arm in arm to sing the team song after a win

props.synopsis: North Melbourne becomes the first male or female VFL/AFL team to win 24 consecutive games after prevailing over Hawthorn by 49 points.

title.children: North makes history with 24th consecutive AFLW win

image.altText: A woman looks at a plant that is tall and has almost black flowers.

props.synopsis: While red roses have their moment on Valentine's Day, these "black suited" irises come into bloom close to Halloween.

title.children: 'Near black' flowers that bloom just in time for Halloween

image.altText: People with their fists raised

props.synopsis: Historic legislation has passed that will see the creation of an Indigenous council that will be consulted on laws and policies affecting Indigenous communities.

title.children: Australian-first treaty legislation passes in Victorian parliament
